segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps polishing that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the faucet is still running, and the sink is just spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading fast, and I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be a total mess if someone doesn’t turn off the water soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, but she’s too distracted to see them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip and fall before she even realizes what’s going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know I should probably do something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting to warn her, but I’m too stunned to move.
segments.speaker: PAR
